raw: France plots gradual exit from lockdown from May 11, but cafes to stay closed .
replaced: France plots gradual exit from the lockdown from May 11, but cafes to stay closed .

raw: PARIS ( Reuters ) - France will begin to ease its coronavirus lockdown from May 11 to avoid an economic meltdown , Prime Minister Edouard Philippe said on Tuesday , but he warned that infections would spiral higher again if the country moved too swiftly .
replaced: PARIS ( Reuters ) - France  France will begin to ease PARIS ( Reuters ) - France  the lockdown from May 11 to avoid an economic meltdown , Philippe said on Tuesday , but Philippe warned that infections would spiral higher again if France moved too swiftly .

raw: French Prime Minister Edouard Philippe delivers a speech to present the government 's plan to unwind the country 's coronavirus lockdown at the National Assembly in Paris , France April 28 , 2020 .
replaced: Philippe delivers a speech to present The government plan to unwind France coronavirus lockdown at the National Assembly in Paris , France April 28 , 2020 .

raw: David Niviere / Pool via REUTERS Schools will gradually reopen and businesses will be free to resume operations , Philippe said in an address to parliament .
replaced: David Niviere / Pool via REUTERS Schools will gradually reopen and businesses will be free to resume operations , Philippe said in an address to parliament .

raw: However , restaurants and cafes will remain closed until at least early June and professional sports , including soccer , will not begin again until the autumn .
replaced: However , restaurants and cafes will remain closed until at least early June and professional sports , including soccer , will not begin again until the autumn .

raw: “ We must protect the French people without paralysing France to the point that it collapses , ” Philippe said .
replaced: “ We must protect the French people without paralysing France to the point that France collapses , ” Philippe said .

raw: “ A little too much carefreeness and the epidemic takes off again .
replaced: “ A little too much carefreeness and the epidemic takes off again .

raw: Too much prudence and the whole country buckles . ”
replaced: Too much prudence and France buckles . ”

raw: More than 23,000 people have died in the pandemic in France , the world ’s fourth highest toll behind the United States , Italy and Spain .
replaced: More than 23,000 people have died in the pandemic in France , the world ’s fourth highest toll behind the United States , Italy and Spain .

raw: But the lockdown had saved tens of thousands of lives , the prime minister said .
replaced: But the lockdown had saved tens of thousands of lives , Philippe said .

raw: The numbers in hospital in France with COVID-19 , the highly contagious lung disease caused by the new coronavirus , have fallen daily for two weeks , while the number of sufferers in intensive care has declined for 19 consecutive days .
replaced: The numbers in hospital in France with COVID-19 , the highly contagious lung disease caused by the virus , have fallen daily for two weeks , while the number of sufferers in intensive care has The easing for 19 consecutive days .

raw: The easing would be underpinned by an aggressive testing and isolation programme , Philippe said .
replaced: The easing would be underpinned by an aggressive testing and isolation programme , Philippe said .

raw: The government was prepared to slow or delay the unwinding if the infection rate rose markedly higher , he said , with administrative departments divided into ‘ red ’ and ‘ green ’ zones .
replaced: The government was prepared to slow or delay the unwinding if the infection rate rose markedly higher , Philippe said , with administrative departments divided into ‘ red ’ and ‘ green ’ zones .

raw: The government will take advantage of the slowing spread of the virus to rescue a free - falling economy , though Philippe said the French people would have to adapt to a new way of living .
replaced: The government will take advantage of the slowing spread of the virus to rescue a free - falling economy , though Philippe said the French people would have to adapt to a new way of living .

raw: “ We are going to have to learn to live with the virus , ” he said .
replaced: “ We are going to have to learn to live with the virus , ” Philippe said .

raw: “ We must learn to live with COVID-19 and to protect ourselves from it . ”
replaced: “ ourselves must learn to live with COVID-19 and to protect ourselves from the virus . ”

raw: TEST , ISOLATE
replaced: TEST , ISOLATE

raw: France ’s blueprint for easing the lockdown reflects a balancing act , with the government keen to relieve the mounting frustration of people holed up in their homes since mid - March without heightening the risk of a second wave of infections .
replaced: France ’s blueprint for easing the lockdown reflects a balancing act , with The government keen to relieve the mounting frustration of people holed up in their homes  people holed up in their homes homes since mid - March without heightening the risk of a second wave of infections .

raw: France will implement a new doctrine on COVID-19 testing from May 11 with the aim of testing everyone who has come into contact with infected people , Philippe said .
replaced: France will implement a new doctrine on COVID-19 testing from May 11 with the aim of testing everyone who has come into contact with infected people , Philippe said .

raw: It targetted a testing capacity of 700,000 per week .
replaced: a new doctrine on COVID-19 testing targetted a testing capacity of 700,000 per week .

raw: All these contact cases will be tested and will be asked to isolate themselves , ” Philippe said .

raw: He said primary schools nationwide can reopen from May 11 , and high schools from May 18 in areas were the infection rate is weak .
replaced: Philippe said primary schools nationwide can reopen from May 11 , and high schools from May 18 in areas were the infection rate is weak .

raw: Lessons would only resume if there were no more than 15 students in the classroom at any one time and secondary school pupils will have to wear masks .
replaced: Lessons would only resume if there were no more than 15 students in the classroom at any one time and secondary school pupils will have to wear masks .

raw: Companies should consider remote - working for at least a week after May 11 and anyone travelling on public transport or in a taxi would also have to wear a mask .

raw: The ban on professional sports upends the 2019 - 2020 Ligue 1 season and impacts the already - delayed Tour de France , which had been postponed until August .
